chess

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Piece is an abstract class that acts as a base to all of the different pieces in the game of chess. It contains many helper functions to help different pieces to find possible positions it can move to. There is one abstract method called availablePositions(), which is implemented in the subclasses.
    Author:
    Capki Kim, Daoun Oh

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(java.lang.String type,
             java.lang.String team,
             int rank,
             int file)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        type - indicates what type of piece it is
        team - indicates if team is black or white
        rank - indicates the vertical position of a piece
        file - indicates the horizontal position of a piece

    • Method Detail

      • availablePositions

        public abstract java.util.List<Position> availablePositions()
        Abstract function for subclasses to implement to find the available positions of pieces that it can move to
        Returns:
        list of positions that a piece can move to

      • addPosition

        public int addPosition(int x,
                       int y,
                       java.util.List<Position> posList)
        Adds the position to the list if it is valid
        Parameters:
        x - the file of a piece
        y - the rank of a piece
        posList - list that contains the possible positions that a piece can move to
        Returns:
        1 if the position is an empty position, 0 if the position contains a piece from the opposing team

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(int rank,
                       int file)
        Checks if the piece can move to a target location.
        Parameters:
        rank - the vertical position of the piece
        file - the horizontal position of the piece
        Returns:
        true if the piece is able to move to the given position, false otherwise

      • check

        public boolean check(java.lang.String team)
        Checks if the King is in check
        Parameters:
        team - the team that check is called upon
        Returns:
        true if check otherwise false

      • findDiagonal

        public java.util.List<Position> findDiagonal()
        Finds all diagonal available positions. Upper-left, upper-right, lower-left, and lower-right.
        Returns:
        list of all possible diagonal positions

      • findStraight

        public java.util.List<Position> findStraight()
        Finds all straight available positions. Up, down, right and left.
        Returns:
        list of all possible straight positions

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Piece piece)
        Overrides the equals method. Compares if the piece is equal with its type, file and rank.
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece it is comparing with
        Returns:
        true if type, file, and rank is equal, otherwise false.

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Gets the type of the piece.
        Returns:
        a string representation of the type. Possible types are bishop, knight, rook, pawn, king, or queen.
